com.google.template.soy.jssrc.internal

Class GenerateSoyUtilsEscapingDirectiveCode

  • java.lang.Object
    • Task
      • com.google.template.soy.shared.internal.AbstractGenerateSoyEscapingDirectiveCode
        • com.google.template.soy.jssrc.internal.GenerateSoyUtilsEscapingDirectiveCode

  • @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public final class GenerateSoyUtilsEscapingDirectiveCode
extends AbstractGenerateSoyEscapingDirectiveCode
    Generates JavaScript code relied upon by soyutils.js and soyutils_use_goog.js.

    This is an ant task and can be invoked as:

    <taskdef name="gen.escape.directives" classname="com.google.template.soy.jssrc.internal.GenerateSoyUtilsEscapingDirectiveCode"> <classpath> <!-- classpath to Soy classes and dependencies --> </classpath> </taskdef> <gen.escape.directives> <input path="one or more JS files that use the generated helpers"/> <output path="the output JS file"/> <libdefined pattern="goog.*"/> <!-- enables closure alternatives --> </gen.escape.directives>

    In the above, the first <taskdef> is an Ant builtin which links the element named <gen.escape.directives> to this class.

    That element contains zero or more <input>s which are JavaScript source files that may use the helper functions generated by this task.

    There must be exactly one <output> element which specifies where the output should be written. That output contains the input sources and the generated helper functions.

    There may be zero or more <libdefined> elements which specify which functions should be available in the context in which <output> is run.

      • generateCharacterMapSignature

        protected void generateCharacterMapSignature(StringBuilder outputCode,
                                             String mapName)
        Description copied from class: AbstractGenerateSoyEscapingDirectiveCode
        Generate the signature to a map object to hold character mapping. All necessary comments and variable declarations should be included in the signature. The map assignment will be appended to the signature. For example. In Javascript the following should be returned: 
           /**
    * Maps characters to the escaped versions for the named escape directives.\n")
    * @type {Object}\n")
    * @private\n")
    *\/
     soy.esc.$$ESCAPE_MAP_FOR_<NAME>_
        Specified by:
        generateCharacterMapSignature in class AbstractGenerateSoyEscapingDirectiveCode
        Parameters:
        outputCode - The StringBuilder where generated code should be appended.
        mapName - The name of this map.
